author: Special Correspondent
text:
Jewellery shops closed on Big Bazar Street in Tiruchi on Wednesday when the jewellers launched their indefinite strike.— PHOTO: A. MURALITHARAN

Continuing their opposition against the Centre’s announcement to re-impose one per cent excise duty on gold jewellery, jewellers went on an indefinite strike here on Wednesday. Jewellery shops located along the Big Bazaar Street and Chinna Kadai Veedhi — the city’s prime commercial hubs and in other places remained shut.

The jewellers demanded the withdrawal of the one per cent excise duty announced by the Centre.

Expressing protest over the government’s announcement the jewellers resorted to a three-day strike by downing shutters recently. The jewellers’ contention is that the imposition of one per cent excise duty on gold jewellery would impact the business of the jewellers.
title: Jewellers go on indefinite strike
